active_learning.discussion_prompt: In the context of cybersecurity governance, rank customer perspective goals (e.g., data protection, privacy, trust, compliance, risk mitigation) by importance for different industries like healthcare vs. e-commerce. Debate and justify with peers why priorities shift, referencing NIST CSF mappings.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Generate 30 high-quality flashcards on 'Customer Perspective Goals' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Governance Principles > Goals Cascade and Alignment > Enterprise Goals > Customer Perspective Goals). Incorporate these elements: - Research Context: Customer goals = data protection (CIA), privacy, trust/transparency, compliance, risk mitigation, confidence. NIST CSF 2.0 full functions: Govern (oversight/trust), Identify (risks), Protect (safeguards/data protection), Detect (events), Respond (containment), Recover (restoration). Align all to customer goals. Frameworks: COBIT, ISO 27001. Example: Equifax breach failures in Detect/Respond. - Learning Objectives: [Insert full list from JSON above]. - Active Learning: [Insert prompts/exercises from JSON above] – reference in explanations. - Scaffolding: [Insert 4 layers from JSON above] – tag each card to a layer. Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: - 10 Basic Q&A, 10 Cloze, 10 MCQ (1 correct, 3 distractors per protocol). - Distractor Protocol: [Insert rules from JSON above]. - Every card: Question/Front, Answer/Back, Explanation (link Bloom's, layer, NIST mapping, source). Output as JSON array: [{'type': 'Basic', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': '...'}]. Ensure progressive difficulty: Layers 1-2 early cards, 3-4 later. Promote Bloom's progression.
